name: prudishly

in a way that shows you are easily shocked by rude things, especially anything relating to sex: Victorian writers prudishly avoided this subject. See
prude
More examplesFewer examplesEveryone is still having affairs but we seem less prudishly shocked by them. "Oh no wine, you need a clear head," she tells me prudishly. The show is prudishly conventional compared to the experimental nature of his past work.It is said that the Victorians prudishly covered table legs to avoid causing offence.
